pages.title: Catalysts
pages.text: Catalysts are used to apply modifiers to Vault Crystals. There is a random maximum number of Catalysts that can be applied to a Crystal before it becomes $(l)Unmodifiable$(). After adding different Catalysts, the percentage of $(l)Instability$() increases. The higher the percentage of Instability, the higher the chance of a Crystal becoming Unmodifiable.

Before you can apply a Catalyst to a Crystal, it needs to be infused. Place Catalysts inside a $(l)Catalyst Infusion Table$() together with $(l)Mystical Essence$() and the Catalyst automatically gets infused with a random set of modifiers.

pages.title: Inscriptions
pages.text: Inscriptions $(l)modify$() a crystal to add an $(l)omega or challenging room$() that generally yields you great loot. $(br2)Inscriptions can be created in the $(l)inscription table$().

pages.title: Inscriptions
pages.text: Empty inscriptions can be found in omega living chests and inscription pieces in any living chest and wooden chest. $(br2)An inscription rolls $(l)Completion$(), $(l)Time$() and $(l)Instability$() randomly. Found inscriptions have a bigger roll range than those crafted. $(l)Completion$() is a mechanic where parts of the vault (to the % of uncompleted) will be replaced with vault bedrock.

pages.title: Motes
pages.text: With every Catalyst, there is a chance that the Crystal applies a hidden $(l)Cursed Modifier$(). The number of skulls depicts the number of Cursed Modifiers on the Crystal. Motes are used to reveal or remove those curses. $(li)$(l)Mote of Clarity$() reveals all curses $(li)$(l)Mote of Purity$() removes a random curse $(li)$(l)Mote of Sanctity$() removes all curses

pages.title: Soul Flame
pages.text: The soul flame is a crystal modifier that will apply $(l)Afterlife$() to the Vault. It can only be applied to any $(l)unmodified$() crystal to prevent item loss on death. This item can't be added to a crystal in Casual Mode.
